member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramDragInteraction
member.summary: Specifies the mouse-left-button drag interaction for .

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramDragInteraction.None
member.summary: The mouse does not interact with the diagram surface.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramDragInteraction.Zoom
member.summary: Dragging the mouse performs a zoom operation. When the mouse left button is released, the diagram is zoomed to the area surrounded by the rectangle drawn while dragging.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramDragInteraction.Pan
member.summary: Dragging the mouse performs a pan operation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramDragInteraction.Select
member.summary: Dragging the mouse performs a select operation. If the is set to , when the mouse left button is released, the items that are fully contained within the area surrounded by the rectangle drawn while dragging, are selected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramTool.Pointer

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramNode.CalculateAbsolutePointInBounds(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Transforms a point from relative coordinates to absolute coordinates within the node's bounds.
member.param: A point with coordinates from (0, 0) to (1, 1).
member.returns: The absolute point within the node's bounds.
member.remarks:
For a node with Bounds rectangle with a size of (200, 100), when called with the Point (0.25, 0.4), this method will return the Point (50, 40).
This method also takes into account the StrokeThickness of the node.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DiagramNode.CalculateAbsolutePoint(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute point (in coordinates) from a relative point.
member.param: A point with coordinates from (0, 0) to (1, 1).
member.remarks: For a node with Bounds rectangle (X:20, Y:300, W:200, H:100), when called with the Point (0.25, 0.4), this method will return the Point (70, 340). This method also takes into account the StrokeThickness of the node.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamDiagram.ClearUndoRedoHistory(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes all the Undo and Redo history that relates to this XamDiagram.
member.param: Indicates whether this method should affect the current open RootTransaction on the if there is one.

remarks.para: Note: this is equivalent to calling the 's RemoveAll method with a filter that removes only undo units whose Target is this XamDiagram. By default that will be all of the history, however, since the property is settable it is possible to share a single instance of an UndoManager with more that one XamDiagram so that there histories are mingled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamDiagram.SelectedDataItems
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of data items associated with the diagram items in the SelectedItems collection.
member.value: An array containing the data items of the selected diagram items or null.

remarks.para: This property is exposed as an object array (instead of IEnumerable or IList) so that there should be no confusion about its behavior. When the selection changes a new object array is created (as an atomic operation) from the SelectedItems collection. The of each in that collection is used to popluate the new array. To change the diagram items selection an application can set this property (either explicitly or through a binding) to a new array of its data items.
